frame.name: Categorization
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Cognizer</fen> construes an <fen>Item</fen> as belonging to a certain <fen>Category</fen>. In this process, the <fen>Cognizer</fen> may either passively perceive the <fen>Item</fen> and note that it fits the <fen>Criteria</fen> for a <fen>Category</fen>, or, alternatively, actively examine the <fen>Item</fen> for certain <fen>Criteria</fen> that define a <fen>Category</fen> (or set of <fen>Category</fen>s).
Most members of the frame can also describe a resulting cognitive state of the <fen>Cognizer</fen> with respect to the <fen>Item</fen> and <fen>Category</fen> which no longer requires the current perception or consideration of the <fen>Item</fen>. A few LUs (e.g. <ment>peg.v, pigeonhole.v</ment>) do not readily allow stative interpretation, and a few LUs (e.g. <ment>deem.v, regard.v</ment>) only allow stative interpretation.
<ex><fex name="Cognizer">You</fex> 've already <t>stereotyped</t> <fex name="Item">me</fex> <fex name="Category">as a bimbo</fex>, have n't you?</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer
FE.definition:
<def-root>This is the person who performs an act of categorization. Typically, this frame element is expressed as an External Argument.
<ex><fex name="Cognizer">Kim</fex> <t>categorized</t> the books under fiction. <fex name="Cognizer">Kim</fex> <t>categorized</t> them on the basis of genre.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Item
FE.definition:
<def-root>This is the entity which is construed or treated by the <fen>Cognizer</fen> as being an instance of a particular <fen>Category</fen>. Typically, the <fen>Item</fen> is expressed as an Object.
<ex>Kim <t>categorized</t> <fex name="Item">the books</fex> under fiction.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Category
FE.definition:
<def-root>This frame element expresses a general type or class of which the <fen>Item</fen> is considered an instance. Typically, it is expressed in a prepositional phrase headed by <ment>as</ment> or <ment>under</ment>.
<ex>Kim <t>categorized</t> the book <fex name="Category">as/under fiction</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Criteria
FE.definition: <def-root>This frame element expresses properties of the <fen>Item</fen> which is used as a basis for categorization. <fen>Criteria</fen> are the general dimensions along which <fen>Item</fen>s can potentially differ from one another and hence, fall into different <fen>Category</fen>s. For example, a paint sample can be classified <ment>by color</ment> or <ment>by finish (matte or gloss)</ment>; if they are classified by color, one can be classified <ment>as orange</ment> and another <ment>as red</ment>. The <fen>Criteria</fen> FE is typically expressed as a PP headed by <ment>by</ment>, or as a complex PP of the form <ment>on the basis of...</ment>: <ex>The students were <t>categorized</t> <fex name="Crit">on the basis of their test scores</fex>.</ex> <ex>The librarian <t>classified</t> the books <fex name="Crit">by subject</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate when a certain Categorization was made.
<ex> <fex name="Time">20 years ago</fex> people would <t>consider</t> this as nothing unusual</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Circumstances</fen> are the set of conditions in which the categorization holds. <ex><fex name="Item">Material posessions</fex> are <t>defined</t> <fex name="Category">as valuable</fex> <fex name="Circumstances">in a particular society</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Concessive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause. </def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The reason for which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> categorizes the <fen>Item</fen> in the given way.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: categorization.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of categorizing

lexUnit.name: categorize.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: place in a particular category; classify.

lexUnit.name: class.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: assign or regard as belonging to a particular category.

lexUnit.name: classification.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a category into which something is put

lexUnit.name: classify.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: assign (someone or something) to a particular class or category

lexUnit.name: construe.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: interpret in a particular way.

lexUnit.name: interpret.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: understand as having a particular meaning or significance

lexUnit.name: interpretation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: explanation; the act or result of interpreting

lexUnit.name: perceive.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: regard as

lexUnit.name: regard.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: consider in a particular way.

lexUnit.name: translate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to understand as having a certain meaning

lexUnit.name: count.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: regard or be regarded as possessing a quality or fulfilling a role

lexUnit.name: peg.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to place in a particular category

lexUnit.name: pigeonhole.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: assign to a particular category, especially an overly restrictive one

lexUnit.name: stereotype.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: view or represent as a stereotype

lexUnit.name: typecast.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: regard as fitting a stereotype

lexUnit.name: understand.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: interpret or view in a particular way.

lexUnit.name: conceive.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to categorize by mentally classifying

lexUnit.name: consider.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: believe to be.

lexUnit.name: define.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: distinguish or characterize

lexUnit.name: view.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: regard in a particular light or with a particular attitude.

lexUnit.name: render.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: declare an item (as being part of some category)

lexUnit.name: see.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: regard in a specified way.

lexUnit.name: identify.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: recognize or categorize (often a particular instance of something) as being in a category.

lexUnit.name: deem.v
lexUnit.definition: COD regard or consider in a specified way.

lexUnit.name: bracket.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: consider to be a member of a group or type.

lexUnit.name: read.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to interpret in a certain way

lexUnit.name: category.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: Classifications created by shared similarity
